title: Gower Wild Swimming Weekend
tagline: Coves, caves, and cold water therapy
suitableFor: Active adults comfortable in cold water and with some coastal walking. Previous wild swimming experience is recommended.
notSuitableFor: Those with limited mobility, fear of heights, or those who are not confident swimmers. Young children.

stops.title: Coasteering at Port Eynon
stops.description: Explore the coastline with Gower Activity Centres, scrambling over rocks, swimming in hidden coves, and jumping into the sea.

wetAlt.title: Gower Activity Centres Indoor Climbing Wall
wetAlt.description: Learn basic climbing techniques and enjoy an indoor climbing session.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Port Eynon Beach and Dunes
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a free walk along the beach and through the dunes, taking a dip in the sea if you dare.

stops.title: The Ship Inn, Port Eynon
stops.description: A traditional pub with sea views serving hearty lunches.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Overton Mere
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own picnic with views of the sea

stops.title: Wild Swimming at the Blue Pool
stops.description: A deep tidal pool perfect for a refreshing swim (check tide times!). Walk along the coast to reach the Blue Pool.

wetAlt.title: National Waterfront Museum Swansea
wetAlt.description: Explore the history of Welsh industry and innovation.

budgetAlt.title: Free exploration of the rock pools
budgetAlt.description: Spend time exploring the various rock pools looking for marine life.

stops.title: Port Eynon Beach Campsite
stops.description: A campsite right on the beach, perfect for early morning swims. Walking distance to the pub.
stops.travelToNext: 30 min drive to Three Cliffs Bay Campsite

budgetAlt.title: Llangennith Campsite
budgetAlt.description: Camping fields close to the beach.

stops.title: Wild Swimming at Three Cliffs Bay
stops.description: Swim in the iconic Three Cliffs Bay, taking in the stunning scenery. Be aware of currents.

wetAlt.title: Swansea Museum
wetAlt.description: Explore the local history and art collections.

budgetAlt.title: Beach combing at Three Cliffs Bay
budgetAlt.description: Stroll along the sands looking for washed-up treasures.

stops.title: Three Cliffs Coffee Shop
stops.description: A cafe close to the beach, selling light meals and cakes.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch on Pennard Cliffs
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your picnic whilst overlooking the cliffs

stops.title: Walk to Fall Bay
stops.description: Take a scenic walk along the coast path to Fall Bay, another secluded swimming spot. Requires some clambering.

wetAlt.title: Plantasia, Swansea
wetAlt.description: Explore a tropical rainforest environment indoors.

budgetAlt.title: Relax on Rhossili Bay
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy sunbathing and relaxing on the stunning beach at Rhossili

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Gower weather can be unpredictable. Pack for all conditions. Sea temperatures are cold, even in summer. Check tide times before swimming in tidal pools.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy in Gower during peak season, especially on weekends. Arrive early to popular spots. Parking at Three Cliffs Bay requires a walk to the beach.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Coasteering and surfing activities should be booked in advance, especially during school holidays.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A moderate level of fitness is required for coastal walks and coasteering. Swimming ability is essential.
